values.description:
Add migration guide for sdformat protocol changes between 1.5 and 1.6. I just did a meld between the 1.5 and 1.6 folders on the default branch. We could do a similar meld for 1.4 -> 1.5 to improve documentation, but that will be a larger job.

We can also create a Migration document for the sdformat C++ API, but that can be addressed in a separate pull request.
values.title: Migration guide sdf 1.5 -> 1.6

summary.raw:
Add migration guide for sdformat protocol changes between 1.5 and 1.6. I just did a meld between the 1.5 and 1.6 folders on the default branch. We could do a similar meld for 1.4 -> 1.5 to improve documentation, but that will be a larger job.

We can also create a Migration document for the sdformat C++ API, but that can be addressed in a separate pull request.
summary.html:
Add migration guide for sdformat protocol changes between 1.5 and 1.6. I just did a meld between the 1.5 and 1.6 folders on the default branch. We could do a similar meld for 1.4 -> 1.5 to improve documentation, but that will be a larger job.

We can also create a Migration document for the sdformat C++ API, but that can be addressed in a separate pull request.

values.title: Fix problems related to cppcheck in Wily

summary.html:
cppcheck in Wily is reporting some problems. This PR turns it blue

I would say that the test/integration/locale_fix is a false positive on a pointer dereference which I think that is not really done.

The other two in constructors are more interesting. It is complaining about the lack of the keyword explicit in constructors with one parameter. IMHO, cppcheck is probably referring to converting constructors which involves implicit conversions, which, under some circumstances, could be consider dangerous.

Probably the easiest way to see the difference is with an example:

struct Foo
{
  Foo(int x) :
    _n(x)
  { }

  int _n;
};

struct Bar
{
  explicit Bar(int x) :
    _n(x)
  { }

  int _n;
};

int main()
{
    Foo p1(1);   // fine
    Foo p11 = 1; // converting 1 to constructor
    Bar p2(1);   // fine
    Bar p22 = 1; // error: conversion from ‘int’ to non-scalar type ‘Bar’ requested 

    return 1;
}

This can probably make downstream code to fail if it uses string_set or any_set classes.

values.description:
TinyXML is not searched for in the  `sdf_config.cmake.in`, so including the file `include/sdf/parser.hh` in a downstream project would give an error unless the downstream projects uses TinyXML as well. 

Given that having the TinyXML symbols in the public headers could cause problems when migrating from TinyXML to a different XML library and that TinyXML-handling functions are never used in Gazebo, I assume that those function are better suited to a private header.
values.title: Move functions that use TinyXML symbols to private headers

summary.raw:
TinyXML is not searched for in the  `sdf_config.cmake.in`, so including the file `include/sdf/parser.hh` in a downstream project would give an error unless the downstream projects uses TinyXML as well. 

Given that having the TinyXML symbols in the public headers could cause problems when migrating from TinyXML to a different XML library and that TinyXML-handling functions are never used in Gazebo, I assume that those function are better suited to a private header.
summary.html:
TinyXML is not searched for in the sdf_config.cmake.in, so including the file include/sdf/parser.hh in a downstream project would give an error unless the downstream projects uses TinyXML as well.

Given that having the TinyXML symbols in the public headers could cause problems when migrating from TinyXML to a different XML library and that TinyXML-handling functions are never used in Gazebo, I assume that those function are better suited to a private header.

values.description:
* In Gazebo `cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake`, we do `find_package(SDFormat ...)`
* In `sdformat/build/install/Release/lib/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake`, we do `find_package(ign-math)` but we should do `find_package(ign_math2)`.

This problem only happens on Windows because in SDFormat `cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake`, the variable `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` is not set. On Windows we define `IGNITION-MATH-LIBRARY_DIRS` and `IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS` in `configure.bat`, and that makes the condition `false` in the `if` statement that sets the `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` variable.
values.title: Fix SDFormatConfig.cmake on Windows

summary.raw:
* In Gazebo `cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake`, we do `find_package(SDFormat ...)`
* In `sdformat/build/install/Release/lib/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake`, we do `find_package(ign-math)` but we should do `find_package(ign_math2)`.

This problem only happens on Windows because in SDFormat `cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake`, the variable `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` is not set. On Windows we define `IGNITION-MATH-LIBRARY_DIRS` and `IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS` in `configure.bat`, and that makes the condition `false` in the `if` statement that sets the `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` variable.
summary.html:
• In Gazebo cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake, we do find_package(SDFormat ...)
  • In sdformat/build/install/Release/lib/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake, we do find_package(ign-math) but we should do find_package(ign_math2).

This problem only happens on Windows because in SDFormat cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake, the variable IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION is not set. On Windows we define IGNITION-MATH-LIBRARY_DIRS and IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS in configure.bat, and that makes the condition false in the if statement that sets the IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION variable.

This problem only happens on Windows because in SDFormat `cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake`, the variable `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` is not set. On Windows we define `IGNITION-MATH-LIBRARY_DIRS` and `IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS` in `configure.bat`, and that makes the condition `false` in the `if` statement that sets the `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` variable.

summary.raw:
* In Gazebo `cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake`, we do `find_package(SDFormat ...)`
* In `sdformat/build/install/Release/lib/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake`, we do `find_package(ign-math)` but we should do `find_package(ign_math2)`.

This problem only happens on Windows because in SDFormat `cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake`, the variable `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` is not set. On Windows we define `IGNITION-MATH-LIBRARY_DIRS` and `IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS` in `configure.bat`, and that makes the condition `false` in the `if` statement that sets the `IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION` variable.
summary.html:
• In Gazebo cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake, we do find_package(SDFormat ...)
  • In sdformat/build/install/Release/lib/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake, we do find_package(ign-math) but we should do find_package(ign_math2).

This problem only happens on Windows because in SDFormat cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake, the variable IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION is not set. On Windows we define IGNITION-MATH-LIBRARY_DIRS and IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS in configure.bat, and that makes the condition false in the if statement that sets the IGNITION-MATH_REQUIRED_MAJOR_VERSION variable.

values.description:
pull request #273 improved the precision of `Param::Get` with floating point variables by using `boost::get` when the type is recognized. With boost versions >= 1.58, however, this causes compilation failures when used with unknown types (including the [nightly gazebo builds](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo8-debbuilder/211/)):

* http://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_58_0.html
* https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/547

I added a test that calls `Get<ignition::math::Angle>` on a double param. This passes on [drone](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/1201) and [ubuntu wily with boost 1.54](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-wily-amd64_temp/4/) but [fails to compile with homebrew and boost 1.60](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/59/). I've added an ifdef that uses `boost::relaxed_get` for boost versions >= 1.58.
values.title: Use boost::relaxed_get with boost version >= 1.58

summary.raw:
pull request #273 improved the precision of `Param::Get` with floating point variables by using `boost::get` when the type is recognized. With boost versions >= 1.58, however, this causes compilation failures when used with unknown types (including the [nightly gazebo builds](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo8-debbuilder/211/)):

* http://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_58_0.html
* https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/547

I added a test that calls `Get<ignition::math::Angle>` on a double param. This passes on [drone](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/1201) and [ubuntu wily with boost 1.54](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-wily-amd64_temp/4/) but [fails to compile with homebrew and boost 1.60](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/59/). I've added an ifdef that uses `boost::relaxed_get` for boost versions >= 1.58.
summary.html:
pull request #273 improved the precision of Param::Get with floating point variables by using boost::get when the type is recognized. With boost versions >= 1.58, however, this causes compilation failures when used with unknown types (including the nightly gazebo builds):

  • http://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_58_0.html
  • https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/547

I added a test that calls Get<ignition::math::Angle> on a double param. This passes on drone and ubuntu wily with boost 1.54 but fails to compile with homebrew and boost 1.60. I've added an ifdef that uses boost::relaxed_get for boost versions >= 1.58.

values.title: Use std::cerr instead of sdfwarn in Console constructor (fixes tests on windows #116)
add tag to allow for specification of initial joint position

values.description:
* Make skin not required so we can specify trajectories for simple links without skeletons, see [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=actor&branch=actor) tutorial draft, which goes with Gazbeo branch [generalize_actor](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/generalize_actor%0Ddefault#diff) I'm not sure if this breaks API for sdf 1.6, it's just making something which was `required="1"` into `required="0"`

* Make animation not required, so if we specify a skin file which has an animation, that animation is used. In fact, this is already the behaviour in Gazebo, but when an animation is not defined, we check that its name is `__default__` instead of checking that `sdf->HasElement`.

* Documented all fields for the actor tag, please improve the documentation directly in this PR if something sounds weird or wrong.
values.title: Document actor, make skin and animation optional

summary.raw:
* Make skin not required so we can specify trajectories for simple links without skeletons, see [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=actor&branch=actor) tutorial draft, which goes with Gazbeo branch [generalize_actor](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/generalize_actor%0Ddefault#diff) I'm not sure if this breaks API for sdf 1.6, it's just making something which was `required="1"` into `required="0"`

* Make animation not required, so if we specify a skin file which has an animation, that animation is used. In fact, this is already the behaviour in Gazebo, but when an animation is not defined, we check that its name is `__default__` instead of checking that `sdf->HasElement`.

* Documented all fields for the actor tag, please improve the documentation directly in this PR if something sounds weird or wrong.
summary.html:
• Make skin not required so we can specify trajectories for simple links without skeletons, see this tutorial draft, which goes with Gazbeo branch generalize_actor I'm not sure if this breaks API for sdf 1.6, it's just making something which was required="1" into required="0"

  • Make animation not required, so if we specify a skin file which has an animation, that animation is used. In fact, this is already the behaviour in Gazebo, but when an animation is not defined, we check that its name is __default__ instead of checking that sdf->HasElement.

  • Documented all fields for the actor tag, please improve the documentation directly in this PR if something sounds weird or wrong.

values.title: Get improvement

summary.html:
This pull request simplifies the process of retrieving a value from SDF.

Old method:

if (sdf->HasElement("key")
{
    auto value = sdf->Get<int>("key");
}

New Method

auto value = sdf->Get<int>("key", 0);

if (value.second)
  std::cout <<  "Got value[" << value.first << "]\n";
else
  std::cout << "Using default value[" << value.first << "]\n";

The primary improvement is removing a call to HasElement.

values.description:
For some reason, the URDF parser is adding `self_collide` tags with the default value of `0` when parsing urdf's, but only to certain links. It has something to do with fixed joint reduction, but I'm not sure what. Anyway, this should fix it. Build 4be0374 to see a failing test that illustrates the problem.

This shouldn't affect ABI since the `SDFExtension.hh` header is not installed.

This is needed for SRC.
values.title: Don't add unrequested self_collide tags when parsing URDF's

summary.raw:
For some reason, the URDF parser is adding `self_collide` tags with the default value of `0` when parsing urdf's, but only to certain links. It has something to do with fixed joint reduction, but I'm not sure what. Anyway, this should fix it. Build 4be0374 to see a failing test that illustrates the problem.

This shouldn't affect ABI since the `SDFExtension.hh` header is not installed.

This is needed for SRC.
summary.html:
For some reason, the URDF parser is adding self_collide tags with the default value of 0 when parsing urdf's, but only to certain links. It has something to do with fixed joint reduction, but I'm not sure what. Anyway, this should fix it. Build 4be0374 to see a failing test that illustrates the problem.

This shouldn't affect ABI since the SDFExtension.hh header is not installed.

This is needed for SRC.

values.description:
[gazebo pull request 2207](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2207/semantic_version_7/diff) changed the behavior of choosing which version of a model to use when an exact match the SDF_VERSION isn't found, but it wasn't changed here. I wrote this a while ago, but hadn't written a test. Also it feels weird that this logic is both here and in gazebo. Maybe it should only be here?

At any rate, I don't want to forget about this, so I'm opening a PR.
values.title: Add patch for issue #123 from gazebo PR 2207 that uses ignition::math::SemanticVersion

I wrote this a while ago, but hadn't written a test. Also it feels weird that this logic is both here and in gazebo. Maybe it should only be here?

At any rate, I don't want to forget about this, so I'm opening a PR.

values.title: Remove sdf4 deprecations and bump to 5.0.0

values.description:
This commit contains two fixes:

* The first one is to avoid the hardcoding
of the location of the sdformat library (useful to avoid
in multi-configuration CMake generators such as Visual Studio).

* The second one modifies the logic of copying boost dll in the test
directory to support the installation layout of boost when installed
using vcpkg ( https://github.com/Microsoft/vcpkg ). The logic is still
quite hardcoded, but at least now it does not fail to compile if the files
are not found in the assumed location.
values.title: Fix for compiling with Visual Studio and vcpkg

summary.raw:
This commit contains two fixes:

* The first one is to avoid the hardcoding
of the location of the sdformat library (useful to avoid
in multi-configuration CMake generators such as Visual Studio).

* The second one modifies the logic of copying boost dll in the test
directory to support the installation layout of boost when installed
using vcpkg ( https://github.com/Microsoft/vcpkg ). The logic is still
quite hardcoded, but at least now it does not fail to compile if the files
are not found in the assumed location.
summary.html:
This commit contains two fixes:

  • The first one is to avoid the hardcoding of the location of the sdformat library (useful to avoid in multi-configuration CMake generators such as Visual Studio).

  • The second one modifies the logic of copying boost dll in the test directory to support the installation layout of boost when installed using vcpkg ( https://github.com/Microsoft/vcpkg ). The logic is still quite hardcoded, but at least now it does not fail to compile if the files are not found in the assumed location.

values.description: Mostly motivated by the need of avoid the mixing of different ignition-math major versions in gazebo8.
values.title: Require ignition-math3

summary.raw: Mostly motivated by the need of avoid the mixing of different ignition-math major versions in gazebo8.
summary.html: Mostly motivated by the need of avoid the mixing of different ignition-math major versions in gazebo8.

values.description:
I run the [ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/sdformat-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/12/API_ABI_report/) to see if the change break the ABI compatibility.

Binary compatibility seems to be ok, there are errors in the 'Source compatibility' but I think that they are false positive since the report displays the exactly the same objects removed and added with exactly the same signatures.

We need to merge the corresponding [Linux/Win release-tools PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/360/sdformat-use-of-ign-math3/diff).

 * [Windows build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/120/)
 * [Linux build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/9/)
values.title: Require ignition-math3 (-> sdf4)

Binary compatibility seems to be ok, there are errors in the 'Source compatibility' but I think that they are false positive since the report displays the exactly the same objects removed and added with exactly the same signatures.

We need to merge the corresponding [Linux/Win release-tools PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/360/sdformat-use-of-ign-math3/diff).

summary.html:
I run the ABI checker to see if the change break the ABI compatibility.

Binary compatibility seems to be ok, there are errors in the 'Source compatibility' but I think that they are false positive since the report displays the exactly the same objects removed and added with exactly the same signatures.

We need to merge the corresponding Linux/Win release-tools PR.

  • Windows build
  • Linux build
